page.title: 01Mid-Northumberland Farmland
page.content: rolling land mostly 250-300 feet. Settlemets only small hamlets, farmsteads and isolated houses. the hamlet of Helm is on a prominent hillwith ine views; paxtondean is almost a secret valley, with few means of access. The only service is a pub, The Oak, on the layby at Causey Park (Al) Bridge. The A11 goes through the area, and there is a little bed and breakfast trade. Bus routes all on the A1, so missing most of the settlements. Hedges neat but gappy (not layered). Some fences. No stone walls, but plenty of houses of sandstone. Plenty of small wood and mature hedgerow trees. Mixture of grass and crops. Some store cattle of mixed breed. Sheep - both black and white faces, and blue or pink raddle behind.Some old pastures under ridge and farrow. More completely devoted
